ExecDesc: 3CTftpSvc <= 2.0.1 (Long Transporting Mode) Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
EngDesc: This threat uses a large buffer sent to a vulnerable TFTP server triggering a buffer overflow or denial of service condition. 3CTftpSvc is a TFTP server that typically listens on udp port 69.

ExecDesc: 3CTftpSvc <= 2.0.1 (Long Transporting Mode) Buffer Overflow Vulnerability (IPv6 Version)
EngDesc: This threat uses a large buffer sent to a vulnerable TFTP server triggering a buffer overflow or denial of service condition. 3CTftpSvc is a TFTP server that typically listens on udp port 69. (IPv6 Version)

ExecDesc: TFTP Server Error Packet Handling Buffer Overflow
EngDesc: A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in TFTP Server. The flaw is due to improper handling of TFTP error packets with overly long error messages. An unauthenticated remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted TFTP error packets to the target host. Successful attack could allow for arbitrary code execution with privileges of the server process, normally System on Windows platforms and root on UNIX/Linux platforms. If the attack is not successful in code injection and execution, the target TFTP server process will terminate upon exploitation. If an attack results in successful code injection and its subsequent execution, the behaviour of the target host will depend on the intention of the attacker. Note that any code execution will be within the security context of the affected service, normally System.

ExecDesc: Dnsmasq TFTP Service Remote Heap Buffer Overflow
EngDesc: A heap based buffer overflow vulnerability has been reported in Dnsmasq. The vulnerability is due to improper bounds checking when handling TFTP Read requests. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted RRQ packet to the target server. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability can lead to arbitrary code execution within the security context of the affected service. An unsuccessful code execution attempt can lead to abnormal termination of the vulnerable program.

ExecDesc: Dnsmasq TFTP Service Remote Heap Buffer Overflow
EngDesc: A heap based buffer overflow vulnerability has been reported in Dnsmasq. The vulnerability is due to improper bounds checking when handling TFTP Read requests. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted RRQ packet to the target server. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability can lead to arbitrary code execution within the security context of the affected service. An unsuccessful code execution attempt can lead to abnormal termination of the vulnerable program.

ExecDesc: Dnsmasq TFTP Service Remote Heap Buffer Overflow
EngDesc: A heap based buffer overflow vulnerability has been reported in Dnsmasq. The vulnerability is due to improper bounds checking when handling TFTP Read requests. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted RRQ packet to the target server. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability can lead to arbitrary code execution within the security context of the affected service. ExecDesc: HP Intelligent Management Center TFTP Server MODE Remote Code Execution
EngDesc: A vulnerability has been identified in a component of the HP Intelligent Management Center (tftpserver.exe). When processing the MODE field, user input is copied to a buffer on the stack without properly checking its length first, allowing an attacker to overwrite data on the stack. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code under the security context of the SYSTEM user. In the event code execution is unsuccessful, this may lead to termination of the service.

ExecDesc: HP Intelligent Management Center TFTP Server MODE Remote Code Execution IPv6 version
EngDesc: A vulnerability has been identified in a component of the HP Intelligent Management Center (tftpserver.exe). When processing the MODE field, user input is copied to a buffer on the stack without properly checking its length first, allowing an attacker to overwrite data on the stack. In the event code execution is unsuccessful, this may lead to termination of the service.

ExecDesc: AT-TFTP <= 1.9 (Long Filename) Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability (POC)
EngDesc: This threat uses a large buffer sent to a vulnerable TFTP server triggering a buffer overflow or denial of service condition. AT-TFTP is a TFTP server that typically listens on udp port 69.

ExecDesc: AT-TFTP <= 1.9 (Long Filename) Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability (POC) (IPv6 Version)
EngDesc: This threat uses a large buffer sent to a vulnerable TFTP server triggering a buffer overflow or denial of service condition. AT-TFTP is a TFTP server that typically listens on udp port 69.  (IPv6 Version)

ExecDesc: TFTP Long Transfer Mode String
EngDesc: This threat sends a TFTP request with a long transfer mode string. This is known to cause crashes in certain TFTP servers, possibly leading to remote code execution.  TFTP servers normally listen on port 69.

ExecDesc: TFTP Long Transfer Mode String (IPv6 Version)
EngDesc: This threat sends a TFTP request with a long transfer mode string. This is known to cause crashes in certain TFTP servers, possibly leading to remote code execution.  TFTP servers normally listen on port 69. (IPv6 Version)

ExecDesc: TFTPD32 Denial of Service
EngDesc: This threat sends a request for a file of 508 A's.  Causes instability and possible crashing in the tftpd32 daemon.  The TFTP service typically listens on UDP port 69.

ExecDesc: TFTPD32 Denial of Service (IPv6 Version)
EngDesc: This threat sends a request for a file of 508 A's.  Causes instability and possible crashing in the tftpd32 daemon.  The TFTP service typically listens on UDP port 69. (IPv6 Version)

ExecDesc: Tftpd32 Format String Vulnerability
EngDesc: This threat sends a malicious TFTP GET request containing a format string which causes a spurious write ending in a crash. Tftpd32 is a TFTP daemon which typically listens on port 69

ExecDesc: Tftpd32 Format String Vulnerability (IPv6 Version)
EngDesc: This threat sends a malicious TFTP GET request containing a format string which causes a spurious write ending in a crash. Tftpd32 is a TFTP daemon which typically listens on port 69 (IPv6 Version)

ExecDesc: Tftpd32 SEND / GET Remote Format String Vulnerability
EngDesc: This threat exploits a remote format string vulnerability in Tftpd32 that can be triggered when the server uses the filename passed in TFTP requests to construct an error message. With a specially crafted filename, an attacker can cause arbitrary code execution, resulting in a loss of integrity. TFTPd is a internet application that usually listens on udp port 69

ExecDesc: Tftpd32 SEND / GET Remote Format String Vulnerability (IPv6 Version)
EngDesc: This threat exploits a remote format string vulnerability in Tftpd32 that can be triggered when the server uses the filename passed in TFTP requests to construct an error message. With a specially crafted filename, an attacker can cause arbitrary code execution, resulting in a loss of integrity. TFTPd is a internet application that usually listens on udp port 69 (IPv6 Version)

ExecDesc: TFTPDWIN 0.4.2 Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
EngDesc:
This threat leverages a stack-based buffer overflow in TFTPDWIN 0.4.2 and
earlier that allows for execution of arbitrary code or DoS via a long file name. 
TFTPDWIN is a tftp server that typically listens on udp port 69.
